keyTakeAways: The Louvre Museum in Paris experienced a daylight heist of Napoleonic-era artefacts, described as 'the heist of the century'.
The stolen items are referred to as 'France’s crown jewels' and are of immense cultural and historical value.
French President Emmanuel Macron condemned the theft, calling it an 'attack on a heritage we cherish' and pledged to bring the perpetrators to justice.
Four suspects are currently under investigation, and authorities are racing against time to recover the stolen artefacts, with fears that they may be lost forever.
The incident has drawn global attention and is being widely reported as a major cultural crime with implications for international heritage protection.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A daylight heist at the Louvre Museum in Paris has drawn global attention, with the theft of Napoleonic-era artefacts—referred to as 'France’s crown jewels'—being described as 'the heist of the century'. French President Emmanuel Macron condemned the act as an attack on a cherished national heritage and vowed to bring the perpetrators to justice. Investigators are racing against time to identify four suspects and recover the stolen items, as there are growing fears they may be lost forever.
title: Inside the Louvre heist that stunned the world
